occurrences.text: were faithful. Notice what it said, it was finished. They did the work that they did the work that God called them to do. Notice what it says, according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so did they. No shortcuts. They did it all. Notice in verse number 42, the end of the chapter, Exodus 39 verse 42, according to all that the Lord commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work. And Moses did look upon all the work and behold, they had done it as the Lord had commanded. Even so had they done it and Moses blessed them. Wow. What an amazing time in Israel's history. Chapter 40 of the book of Exodus, one of my favorite chapters of the Bible, because you see what takes place with the rearing up of the tabernacle. We don't have time to read through it, but you'll notice if you read it later on your own, that you'll find a number of references. In fact, 13 times from verse three down through verse number 15, you read this statement, and thou shout. God told them what to do. God explicitly explained to them the instruction that they're to follow. And then you find that the Bible tells us as the Lord commanded Moses, repeated seven times, and you find that they did it. They did the work. They did what God called them to do. And you come to verse number 34.
